reviews.review_msg: I don't understand why her rating is so low. She is very nice and has great lectures that are easy to follow. To be honest her exams are quite hard and aren't very similar to assignments, so they're kind of hard to study for, However, the assignments are very relevant to our lecture material and are very interesting. Going to class pays off though.

The worst professor, lack of any knowledge. If you are thinking of pursuing your studies with her DON'T DO THAT. It is serious alarm!! your life will be ruined and you will end up wasting at least 10 years of your life!!

Her grading is so unfair and based on no clear criteria. She releases grades at the last day and there is no room for asking revision, however, if you ask it, she simply replies your project wasn't good enough without any proof. Also, the materials she teaches is so old-fashion and nobody uses anymore. So, you'd learn nothing and get ban mark!

Very rude professor and poor attitude toward teaching. She herself doesn't have any idea about the course and the only thing she can do is reducing grade. If you're a Boy she likes you otherwise withdraw her course!!

Terrible prof. Many grads have left her lab due to her attitude and lack of good supervision. Cannot teach well due to attitude and lack of knowledge of the subject. Regret having taken a course with her.

Coming to class, practising her examples, and redoing homework assignments are the best way to make it through her class. She admires honesty and hard work, so if you're honest about not knowing something, she'll happily spend time to help you. She( her TA ) marks tough, so prepare as thoroughly as possible for her exams. She has high standards

Very poor teaching technique. Exceptional in being rude to students. What she taught in class and what we had in our mid terms were extremely different. We all studied, but it didn't matter - our fate was already sealed the moment we walked into the classroom. If you want your GPA to drop this class is for you. Class Avg. was C+ btw

Makes a big deal about plagiarism but copies slides from online sources and claims its her's (a PEng!). Gives a difficult quiz in the start of first lecture (who recalls L.A after 3+ years). Assignments are plagiarized from online. Exams are totally unrelated to course material and SUPER tedious. Not helpful, discourages questions. Just terrible!
Poor teaching techniques. Arrogant and gets offensive if students ask any question during her lecture. Most part of hee exam is irrelevant to her teachings. Regret taking course with her.
For whole semester she was really tough, but final was average. You will really learn with her. She is best prof. for ENSC 320. Her teaching is Amazing. She will do scaling at the end.
Happy with my decision to take the course
Horrible prof. Several grad students have left her lab.

Makes claims that she has absolutely no empirical evidence for.  Does not word things in a comprehensible manner.  Totally useless on the subject.  Worst course I've ever taken in my 9-year post-secondary career.  Teaches it like a psychology course, but with no actual psychology theory. DON'T USE SYNONYMS DURING HER TESTS (they confuse her)!
her exams are a waste of my memory. copies the text too much and sometimes doesn't understand the idea herself
I think she need more training before teaching this course. She just read slides. She expect too much from undergrad students. Never take this course with her unless you donot have any other option.

She's a good lecturer and she talks about really interesting stuff. Go to lectures or you'll have a hard time memorizing concepts of the course. Doesn't matter how you do the homeworks, you'll always get high mark. Exams are a bit challenging.

She is a good prof. She gives lots of work to do, makes you learn a lot. The slide notes were more words than pictures, lots of notes to read. She doesn't test them all though. The only thing is that she didn't award enough for the assignments, I mean they should worth more percentages in the course.
